page.title: 04HOUSING
page.content: Danbury offers a tremendous range of building types to the observer.These settlements date from the 16th century to the very modern buildings of the 1980's.Looking into the future at the projected extension of Stanstead Airport,the housing in Danbury will probably be extended,to deal with more employment in the area.Clearly visible are historical buildings which have interesting pasts.Such as Frettons which was origanaly a girls boarding school,and then on to Danbury Palace.A vast range of building materials have contributed to the architecture of the village.These range from Norman arches to wattle and daub to oak beams to the modern red brick. A survey was undertaken from people which go to Danbury Park School and live in Danbury.This demonstrated that most people live in a detached house.
